DOC.brief_summary: Coffee might stimulate bowel movement and thus overcome obstipation in intensive care unit (ICU) patients.
DOC.brief_title: Coffee Against Obstipation in Intensive Care Treatment
DOC.detailed_description: Critically ill patients requiring ventilator support frequently suffer from obstipation. We hypothesize that coffee, administered either orally or rectally, might stimulate bowel movement.
DOC.criteria: admission to the medical intensive care unit of the Dept. of Gastroenterology at the university hospital heidelberg requires ventilator support for an anticipated more than 72 hours age older than 18 years pregnancy known allergy to coffee mechanical ileus presence of enterostoma
